sourcesContent:
MyStore
// header.component.ts import { Component, Input, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; import { MenuItem } from 'primeng/api'; import { PruductService } from '../service/pruduct.service'; import { IProduct, IMenuItem } from '../interface/product'; @Component({ selector: 'app-header', templateUrl: './header.component.html', styleUrls: ['./header.component.scss'] }) export class HeaderComponent implements OnInit { @Input() cartItems: IProduct[] = []; @Input() Count: number = 0; items: MenuItem[] = []; product: IProduct[] = []; category: IMenuItem[] = []; cartCountChange?: number = 0; // UI state sidebarVisible: boolean = false; isDark: boolean = false; searchActive: boolean = false; constructor(private _service: PruductService) {} ngOnInit(): void { // Menu items for desktop menubar this.items = [ { label: 'Home', routerLink: '/' }, { label: 'Contact', routerLink: '/contact' } ]; // initialize badge count from input this.cartCountChange = this.cartItems?.length ?? this.Count ?? 0; // if you want to persist theme between reloads: const saved = localStorage.getItem('theme-dark'); if (saved) { this.isDark = saved === 'true'; this.applyTheme(); } } toggleSidebar() { this.sidebarVisible = !this.sidebarVisible; } toggleTheme() { this.applyTheme(); localStorage.setItem('theme-dark', String(this.isDark)); } applyTheme() { // add/remove class on body for global theme styles if (this.isDark) { document.body.classList.add('theme-dark'); document.body.classList.remove('theme-light'); } else { document.body.classList.add('theme-light'); document.body.classList.remove('theme-dark'); } } getResult(event?: KeyboardEvent | any) { // You can pass typed value or use the service as you had before. const query = event?.target?.value ?? ''; // Example: call service with query (adjust your service method accordingly) // this._service.searchProduct(query).subscribe(res => this.product = res); // For now we keep original contract if your service expects category: this._service.searchProduct(this.category).subscribe(result => this.product = result); } // If cartItems input changes from parent you may want to implement ngOnChanges to update cartCountChange }
